snippet: Postal officials said that an increase in revenue in the second quarter as well as efforts to trim costs were not enough to offset the service’s debt.
abstract: Financially troubled Postal Service reports a net loss of $1.9 billion in the second quarter, same amount it lost over the same period in 2013; reports operating revenue of $16.7 billion, $379 million increase over the same period in 2013; it is the third straight quarter it has posted an increase in revenue.
lead_paragraph: Postal officials said that an increase in revenue in the second quarter as well as efforts to trim costs were not enough to offset the service’s debt.

headline.main: Post Office Says It Lost $1.9 Billion in Quarter
